result.execSummary:
The defendant Mercie M. Grochowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department for work or counseling
*First half to be served in jail and second half on the electronic home monitor if approved by the jail administration and risk assessment

miscConds.notes:
*Pay fine plus costs
*Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.
*Continue with drug treatment and counseling program

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mercie M. Grochowski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mercie M. Grochowski in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:58 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No contest 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
State has complied with victim notification; no victim's appear in Court today.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 - 
Impose/Stay 90 day jail sentence with huber privileges granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department for work or counseling
First half in jail and second half on electric home monitor if approved by the jail and risk assessment 
Placed on Probation for 1 year
***Conditions of Probation:
*Pay restitution in amount of $100.44
*Pay fine of $100 plus costs/surcharges - victim witness surcharge, filing fee, DNA Surcharge 
*Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.
*Continue with drug treatment and counseling program

20 days to appeal

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: $500 sig bond: Not to go on the premises of  Kmart in Stevens Point.  Go to public defender today.

Defendant Mercie M. Grochowski in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.
P/NG entered
Defendant would like to consult with an attorney
Defendant can contact Public Defender for Representation
Court orders defendant to see Public Defender today. 

BTC: $500 sig bond: Not to go on the premises of  Kmart in Stevens Point.  Go to public defender today.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 09:30 am.
